Package gov.sandia.geotessbuilder

Class Triangle

java.lang.Object
java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
java.util.AbstractList<E>
java.util.ArrayList<Vertex>
gov.sandia.geotessbuilder.Triangle
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Vertex>, Collection<Vertex>, List<Vertex>, RandomAccess
public class Triangle extends ArrayList<Vertex>
Triangle is essentially an array of 3 Vertex objects which define a spherical triangle on the surface of a unit sphere. Besides being an array of 3 Vertex objects, a Triangle knows the tessellation level upon which it resides, how many sub triangles it was divided into (if any), who its neighbor triangles are and its descendant if it was subdivided. Each triangle also has an index and a boolean flag indicating whether it is 'marked' or 'unmarked'.
See Also:
Serialized Form

    Constructor that specifies the three Vertex objects that define the corners of the triangle (in clockwise order when viewed from outside the unit sphere), and the tessellation level upon which the new triangle resides.

  • Field Details

    • nDescendants

      protected int nDescendants
      The number of sub-triangles into which this triangle has been divided. Values will range from 0 to 4, inclusive.

  • Constructor Details

    • Triangle

      Constructor that specifies the three Vertex objects that define the corners of the triangle (in clockwise order when viewed from outside the unit sphere), and the tessellation level upon which the new triangle resides.
      Parameters:
      ancestor - the triangle that is the ancestor of this triangle
      n1 -
      n2 -
      n3 -
      tessLevel -

  • Method Details

    • getSolidAngle

      public double getSolidAngle()
      Retrieve the solid angle subtended by this triangle, in square radians. This number times Earth radius squared is equal to the area of the spherical triangle. It is assumed that the corners of the triangle are not on same great circle.
      Returns:
      double solid angle subtended by this triangle, in square radians.

    • inside

      public int inside​(double[] point)
      Returns 1 if point is inside this Triangle, 0 if it is on the boundary, or -1 if it is outside this Triangle.
      Parameters:
      point -
      Returns:
      1 (inside), 0 (on), or -1 (outside).

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class AbstractCollection<Vertex>

    • divide

      public void divide​(Collection<Triangle> triangles)
      Divide this triangle up into 4 new triangles which will reside on the next higher tessellation level. Updates all the Edge objects and sets the descendant of this triangle to the central triangle of the 4 new triangles. All tessLevels are set properly. Does nothing about neighbors.
      Parameters:
      triangles -

    • getTransitionTriangles

      public ArrayList<Triangle> getTransitionTriangles() throws GeoTessException
      Make transition triangles based on this triangle. This triangle will be divided into anywhere from one to four new triangles, depending on the number of populated edges in this triangle.
      Returns:
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • getIndex

      public int getIndex()
      Retrieve the index of this triangle. Index is local variable that is never modified in the Triangle class. Available for use by caller.
      Returns:

      public boolean needsDivision()

      Returns:
      boolean

    • getNeighborIndex

      public int getNeighborIndex​(Triangle t)
      Given some other triangle t, see if t is neighbor of this triangle. If so, return the index of t in this triangle's array of neighbors (an int in range 0..2). If not, return -1;
      Parameters:
      t -
      Returns:

      public Triangle getNeighbor​(int i)

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • getDescendant

      protected Triangle getDescendant()
      Retrieve a reference to the triangle that is the descendant of this triangle. If this triangle does not have a descendant, return null. The descendant of this triangle resides on the next higher tessellation level from this trinagle.
      Returns:

    • setDescendant

      protected void setDescendant​(Triangle descendant)
      Set the descendant of this triangle. The descendant of this triangle resides on the next higher tessellation level from this triangle.
